message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.CL, cs.DB. 

The paper discusses an extension of Answer Set Programming (ASP) with support for arithmetic expressions and consistency-restoring rules. ASP is a subfield of Artificial Intelligence (AI) that deals with knowledge representation and reasoning. The addition of arithmetic expressions and inequality relations suggests a focus on logic and reasoning (LO) with numerical constraints. The use of consistency-restoring rules is a feature of Constraint Logic Programming (CLP), which is closely related to ASP. Therefore, cs.AI, cs.LO, and cs.CL are likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper may be relevant to the sub-categories of Programming Languages (cs.PL) and Databases (cs.DB) due to the focus on language extensions and knowledge representation.
